member.name: F:Okuma.CGCMDAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logException
member.summary: Level 1 – All exceptions will be logged by the system. (not settable). It is highly not recommended to have polling routines that produce exceptions for any purposes.

member.name: F:Okuma.CGCMDAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logSet
member.summary: Level 2 – Level 1 + all write functions to the API (default value for all class instances)

member.name: F:Okuma.CGCMDAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logGet
member.summary: Level 3 – Level 2 + all read functions. Setting the level to 3 or greater will force logging of ALL calls to the API to facilitate debugging of your application. This function is CPU intensive and should only be used for debugging purposes.

member.name: F:Okuma.CGCMDAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logAll
member.summary: Level 4 – all logging events regardless of level. Setting the level to 3 or greater will force logging of ALL calls to the API to facilitate debugging of your application. This function is CPU intensive and should only be used for debugging purposes.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Create an instance of this class. In addition to library name, the provided logging name will be used for logging all function calls
Logging Name. Globally, The logging name will be combined with library name as the logging name for all logging message.
Only the first instance of any class created with a logging name will be used otherwise, the default logging name will be used. It is recommended to provide an application name and its version as logging name per instancing of class.
[Lhuynh] 12/4/2007 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

This example shows how to call the GetLastErrorMessage method.
Dim strMessage As String Try txtMessage.Text = objCMD.GetLastErrorMessage() Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("Command API", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("Command API", ex.Message) End Try

member.name: M:Okuma.CGCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CBase.SetLoggingLevelToAll
member.summary:
Set logging level to LoggingLevelEnum.logAll for this instance
The system will not log operations having logging level above this setting level.
member.remarks: Note: It is highly recommended for debugging purpose only Note2: All exceptions and writing operations to NC will be logged automatically

members.member:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Project : Okuma.CGCMDAPI Class : CGCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CBase
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
It is a base class for all classes of Command API. All classes in Command API will be derived from this class to handle error handling, logging service, and other services for internal data structure of this library ONLY.
It should not be create directly by any client application.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Create an instance of this class. In addition to library name, the provided logging name will be used for logging all function calls
Logging Name. Globally, The logging name will be combined with library name as the logging name for all logging message.
Only the first instance of any class created with a logging name will be used otherwise, the default logging name will be used. It is recommended to provide an application name and its version as logging name per instancing of class.
[Lhuynh] 12/4/2007 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets user alarm
Alarm Message displayed on NC-HMI will have the following format:
FOR ALARM D: 4127 ALARM-D THiNC Alarm + strAlarmMessage
FOR ALARM C: 3127 ALARM-C THiNC Alarm + strAlarmMessage
FOR ALARM B: 2127 ALARM-B THiNC Alarm + strAlarmMessage
This example shows how to call the SetUserAlarm method.
Dim objCmdMachine As New Okuma.CGCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMachine Dim enUserAlarm As UserAlarmEnum = UserAlarmEnum.B Dim strAlarmMessage As String = "User Alarm B" objCmdMachine = New Okuma.CGCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMachine objCmdMachine.SetUserAlarm(enUserAlarm, strAlarmMessage)
alarm level to be set alarm message to be set for this alarm level. String length must be equal to or less than 15 characters. Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
[Lhuynh] 08/05/2019 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Clear user alarm D
This example shows how to call the ClearUserAlarmD method.
Dim objCmdMachine As Okuma.CGCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMachine objCmdMachine = New Okuma.CGCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMachine objCmdMachine.ClearUserAlarmD()
Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
The user alarm message is cleared on NC HMI but it does not consider as an NC Reset. As a result, if the D User Alarm message is raised again it will not generate an event record on the MacMan Alarm History unless it is explicitly or implicicty cleared by NC.
[Lhuynh] 08/05/2019 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Load the specified part program file into NC. Optionally, it can also load sub program file name, or run a particular program name.
This example shows how to call the SelectMainProgram mothod.
Dim objcprogram As New CGCMDAPI.CProgram objcprogram.SelectMainProgram(strMainProgram, strSubProgram, strProgramName, prog4.Text)
Main program file name to be loaded into NC Sub program file name for this main program Name of program in the main program file to be run. Name must be starting with an O and a maximum length of characters is 5. sub folder path from default program folder which is D:\MD1 Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
All files should be located in the default MD1 folder of the OSP system.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Create an instance of this class. In addition to library name, the provided logging name will be used for logging all function calls
Logging Name. Globally, The logging name will be combined with library name as the logging name for all logging message.
Only the first instance of any class created with a logging name will be used otherwise, the default logging name will be used. It is recommended to provide an application name and its version as logging name per instancing of class.
[Lhuynh] 12/4/2007 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:Okuma.CGCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CProgram.SelectMainProgram(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Load the specified part program file into NC. Optionally, it can also load sub routines based on sub program file name, system subtitute program file name, or a particular program name.
member.example:
This example shows how to call SelectMainProgram method.
Dim strMainProgramFileName As String = "" Dim strSubProgramFileName As String = "" Dim strSystemSubstituteProgramFileName As String = "" Dim strProgramName As String = "" Dim strSubFolder As String = "\Part2\" Dim objCMDProgram As CProgram = New CProgram() if strSubFolder.Trim.Length > 0 then objCMDProgram.SelectMainProgram(strSubFolder + strMainProgramFileName, strSubFolder + strSubProgramFileName, strSubFolder + strSubProgramFileName, strProgramName) else objCMDProgram.SelectMainProgram(strMainProgramFileName, strSubProgramFileName, strSubProgramFileName, strProgramName) End If
member.param: Main program file name to be loaded into NC
Sub program file name to be used for the main program if available
System Subtitute Programe file name (SSB) to be used for the main program if available
Program Name. It can be specified to load a particular program name inside program file name. Program name must be start with capital O plus 4 characters for program name such as O1234.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.remarks: All program files should be located in the default MD1 folder of the OSP system or in sub folder relatively to the MD1 folder.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Load the specified schedule part program file into NC.
This example shows how to call the SelectScheduleProgram mothod.
Dim objcprogram As New CGCMDAPI.CProgram objcprogram.SelectScheduleProgram("A.SDF")
Schedule program file name to be loaded into NC Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
All files should be located in the default MD1 folder of the OSP system.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Load the specified index part program file into NC.
This example shows how to call the SelectIndexProgram mothod.
Dim objcprogram As New CGCMDAPI.CProgram objProgram.SelectIndexProgram("A.IDX")
Index program file name to be loaded into NC Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition. Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
All files should be located in the default MD1 folder of the OSP system.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
